resources.string: If this is a re-calibration (system was already used)be aware that starting this procedure will lose all previously saved height information.Measure and notefender measurements of current heights before starting this procedure if desired.
Maximum height will be determined by your mechanical suspension limits during this procedure.

If this is a re-calibration (system was already used) be aware that starting this procedure will lose all previously saved height information. Measure and note fender measurements of current heights before starting this procedure if desired.
WARNING : Maximum tank pressure will be applied to your Air Springs to find the maximum suspension travel. Damage may be caused to suspensions without proper limiting means.

Calibration will be performed based on your CURRENT Tank Pressure setting. If the Tank Pressure setting is changed in the future you must re-calibrate the system. You can change this setting by using : \10Menu > Setting > Tank Pressure Mode

Your positions are now saved as follows : \10 1. Position 1 = 10% of total travel \10 2. Position 2 = 50% of total travel \10 3. Position 3 = 90% of total travel \10 You can Re-save these Position to your preference by using Menu > Save Heights.
This process requires no user interaction and should take no more than 15 minutes depending on the size of your Compressor(s) and Tank(s)

Your system must be calibrated to learn your vehicle\'s characteristics before the automatic leveling features can be used. This process should be repeated if any system components are changed or replaced in the future. Choose calibration type below:
1. Veryfy wiring and connection to pressure sensor.\10 2.Check Pressure Sensor for failure.
The pressure sensor is not reading.

1. Check Compressor fuse F2.\10 2. Verify Compressor circuit wiring connections.\10 3. Check for Compressor relay failure.\10 4. Verify Compressor plumbing connections.\10 5. Verify ALL extra ports are plugged in tank system.\10 6. Check for Compressor failure.\10 7. Check for Pressure Sensor failure.
Tank pressure is not increasing after the ECU turns the Compressor(s) ON.

1. Use a volt-meter to test voltage across your battery posts with vehicle running.\102. If measured voltage is greater than 16.0V, repair your vehicle alternator/regulator.\103. If measured voltage is normal (less than 14.7V), improve your e-Level ECU ground location.
Vehicle System Voltage is ABOVE 16.0V. Prolonged usage in this state may cause damage to system components.

1. Use a volt-meter to test voltage across your battery posts with vehicle running.\102. If measured voltage is greater than 13.0V, repair your vehicle alternator/regulator.\103. If measured voltage is normal (more than 13.0V), contact AccuAir.

Vehicle System Voltage is BELOW 10.5V so your compressor(s) have been forced OFF.The system will return to normal operation once the vahical system voltage is reached 12.5V or the ignition is cycled.If this problem persist while the vehicle is running then.
Check to see if the Sensor(s) is out of range, disconnected or damaged.

1.Verify Ride Height Sensor mechanical linkage connections(inspect for damaged or disconnected linkage).\10 2. If you removed any of the sensor arms from the Ride Height Sensor during installation,you may have re-installed the arms in the wrong orientation.\10 3. Remount one or more of your Ride Height Sensors to achieve a minium of 1.0V variation from top to bottom of travel(you can use volt-meter to measure the sensor output voltage on the green wire from each of the sensors.)
Ride Height Sensor travel is found to be too small on one or more corners of the vehicle:
1. Check all wiring and connectors between ECU,TouchPad, and WIFI Receiver to assure proper connection.\10 2.Check pressure ssensor for failure.
There is Communicaton Error between the ECU and the TouchPad or WiFi Receiver.
Manually adjust each Air Spring to the desired maximum vehicle height now.

If this is a re-calibration (system was already was used) be aware that starting this process will lose all previously saved height information.Measure and note fender measurement of current heights before starting this procedure if desired.

Your system was shipped with Ride-Height-On-Start enabled (ON). You may choose to disable (OFF) or re-enable (ON) this feature. When this feature is ON, the system will automatically re-level the vehicle to Position #2 (Ride Height) every time that the ignition is switched ON. When this feature is OFF, the system will remain at the last height the vehicle was at when the ignition is switched ON.

adjusts the distance from selected height that the system will consider acceptable. Lower accuracy means that your vehicle won\'t stay as close to the selected height and will also make fewer adjustments (less air usage and less compressor run time). Higher accuracy means that your vehicle will stay very close to the selected height and will also make more frequent adjustments (more air usage and more compressor run time).

Your system was shipped with RideMonitorâ„¢ Mode enabled (ON). You may choose to disable (OFF) or re-enable (ON) this feature. When RideMonitorâ„¢ Mode is ON, the system will Monitor the vehicleâ„¢s height whenever the ignition is ON and make adjustments for changes in load when deemed necessary. When this feature is OFF, the system will only adjust when prompted by pressing the height selection switch â„¢ It will not Monitor the vehicleâ„¢s height and will not make adjustments for changes in load automatically.
Manually adjust each Air Spring to the desired Height. Measure at fenders to make sure vehicle is level from side to side.
Select the position Button 1,2 or 3 for the Position # that you would like to save.
The vehicle must be on level ground with the wheels pointed straight ahead before proceeding. Leave the vehicle running to power the Compressor(s) during this procedure.
WARNING : The system will automatically Raise/Lower the vehicle in the next procedure. Remove all obstructions and KEEP CLEAR of vehicle until the calibration process is complete.
Note : The new tank pressure setting will not take affect until the system is RE-CALIBRATED. You can Re-Calibrate by using : Menu > Calibration

Once a general height adjustment has been made, the e-Levelâ„¢ will begin to monitor this position and make corrections if necessary (when RideMonitorâ„¢ Mode is ON). The first 5 seconds of RideMonitorâ„¢ Mode is called TrimModeâ„¢. For the TrimModeâ„¢, the system holds a tighter tolerance than regular parked mode and makes precise adjustments if necessary. For the most accurate leveling, this feature should be left ON. For applications where this feature could be a nuisance due to frequent starts and stops and where super accurate leveling is not such a concern, this feature can be turned OFF.
Your iLevel is being updated to the latest firmware. Please do not interrupt this process.
